summary: The module implements a multimodal token‑classification model that restores missing punctuation and correct capitalization in transcribed speech. It combines lexical embeddings from a BERT‑style language encoder with acoustic embeddings from an ASR encoder, processes the fused representation through a transformer decoder, and uses separate MLP heads for punctuation and capitalization prediction. The model also includes utilities for adapting its configuration to support adapter modules.
business_intent: Enable speech‑to‑text platforms to automatically produce properly punctuated and capitalized transcripts, improving readability and downstream processing such as analytics, search, and user interaction.
